Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about leveraging data to drive meaningful insights and business decisions? Do you want to contribute to a company that helps individuals achieve their professional goals? If so, this Data Analyst role could be the perfect fit for you!




Your Role as a Data Analyst

As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in shaping data-driven strategies by analyzing complex datasets and delivering actionable insights. Your work will directly impact product development, marketing strategies, and overall business performance. Additionally, you will help optimize internal processes and enhance platform efficiency through data-driven solutions.




Key Responsibilities

Database Optimization: Design and maintain scalable database structures for analytics and insights.
ETL Processes: Develop and manage ETL pipelines to integrate and transform data from multiple sources.
Data Visualization: Create interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Looker Studio to support business decision-making.
User Behavior Analysis: Analyze user engagement, cohort behaviors, and platform performance to improve the user experience.
Payment Data Analysis: Work with payment gateway data (e.g., Stripe, PayPal) to monitor subscription trends and revenue performance.
Collaboration: Partner with cross-functional teams, including development, marketing, finance, and product, to meet data needs.
Compliance: Ensure data handling aligns with GDPR and other relevant regulations.




Who You Are

You are an analytical thinker with a keen eye for detail, capable of translating raw data into meaningful insights. You enjoy working collaboratively but can also drive independent projects to completion. Adaptable and curious, you’re always eager to enhance your skills and contribute to a data-driven culture.




Your Skills and Qualifications

Technical Skills:

Strong proficiency in SQL and Python.
Experience with Looker Studio, BigQuery, and other data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Hands-on experience with ETL tools like Apache Airflow, dbt, or Fivetran.
Familiarity with analytics platforms such as Google Analytics, Mixpanel, or Amplitude.




Education & Experience:

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
3–5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within a SaaS or tech-driven environment.

Bonus Skills:

Experience with machine learning, predictive analytics, or API integrations.
Understanding of career platforms and job seeker behavior analytics.




What’s Offered

A competitive salary based on experience.
25 annual leave days, including your birthday off.
A modern office space with on-site amenities such as a gym, game room, and social areas.
Comprehensive benefits, including meal provisions and transportation support.
A wellness budget to support gym memberships or personal hobbies.
Regular team activities, outings, and networking events.
Opportunities for professional development, including certifications in tools like Looker Studio and BigQuery.

Title: Junior Data Analyst – 1-3 YEARS OF EXPERIENCE!
Description:
Junior Data Analyst – 1-3 YEARS OF EXPERIENCE!




Gain hands-on experience from day one
Work closely with an experienced Senior Data Analyst
Develop expertise in SQL, Power BI, and Tableau




Are you a recent graduate or early-career professional eager to build a strong foundation in data analysis? This is a unique opportunity to join a well-established Irish-owned company that values professional growth and provides a clear pathway to seniority.




We’re looking for a Junior Data Analyst with 1–3 years of experience ready to take the next step in their career. In this role, you’ll gain exposure to real-world business challenges, working across multiple functions to transform complex data into valuable insights that drive strategic decision-making.




Under the guidance of a highly experienced Senior Data Analyst, you’ll receive hands-on training in SQL, Power BI, and Tableau, mastering end-to-end data workflows while making a meaningful impact from day one. This is the perfect opportunity to fast-track your career towards a Senior Data Analyst role!




You will:

Analyse large, complex datasets to uncover key business insights.
Gain hands-on experience with end-to-end data workflows.
Develop expertise in SQL, Power BI, and Tableau.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to influence data-driven decisions.
Receive direct mentorship and structured career development.




Skills/Experience:

1–3 years of experience in Data Analysis or a related field.
Strong proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, or similar).
Experience in data extraction, transformation, and reporting using SQL.

Salary / Remuneration:

€25,000 - €35,000

Pension scheme, Online health support, salary protection, and many more!




For more information contact Joana Mota confidentially at +353 1 649 8532 or email your CV to joana.mota@archer.ie

I specialize in recruiting for Data Analyst, if you wish to discuss this or other opportunities, please feel free to contact me.




For more opportunities, visit: https://www.archer.ie/candidates/

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Skill Development!




Work on impactful, AI-driven projects
Enhance your technical expertise in a supportive environment
Gain exposure across multiple business domains




Applicants must have a Stamp 4 visa or an EU Passport




Join a well-established Irish company known for its stability and commitment to long-term employee development. This is a unique opportunity for a Data Analyst to refine their skills in a collaborative setting while working across multiple domains. The company has a strong track record of retaining its employees, offering a secure and supportive work environment.




As a Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in driving data-driven decision-making, utilizing cutting-edge AI-powered insights and industry-leading tools such as SQL, Power BI, Tableau, and Python. You will work closely with an experienced Senior Data Analyst with over 20 years of industry expertise, ensuring continuous learning, mentorship, and professional growth.




If you are eager to expand your expertise, contribute to impactful projects, and be part of a company that values long-term career progression, this is the perfect opportunity for you.




You will:

Utilize AI-driven analytics to enhance business efficiency and outcomes.
Strengthen your expertise in SQL and visualization tools such as Power BI and Tableau.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to optimize business strategies.
Translate complex datasets into actionable insights for key stakeholders.
Thrive in a dynamic, growth-oriented environment with strong career prospects.




Skills/Experience:

2–3 years of experience in Data Analysis or a related field.
Strong proficiency in SQL, with hands-on experience in Power BI and Tableau.
Excellent communication skills, to present insights effectively to stakeholders.




Salary / Remuneration:

€35.000 - €40.000

Pension scheme, Online health support, salary protection, and many more!




For more information contact Joana Mota confidentially at +353 1 649 8532 or email your CV to joana.mota@archer.ie

I specialize in recruiting for Data Analyst, if you wish to discuss this or other opportunities, please feel free to contact me.




For more opportunities, visit: https://www.archer.ie/candidates/

Title: Data Analyst Junior H/F
Description:
DREAM ENERGY et ARTESOL filiales du groupe ARTEA, sont des entreprises engagées dans la transition énergétique, axées sur le développement et la mise en œuvre de solutions innovantes dans le domaine des énergies renouvelables, l’immobilier et la mobilité électrique. Avec une vision centrée sur la durabilité et la préservation de l'environnement, elles s'efforcent de proposer des technologies efficaces et respectueuses de la planète. Grâce à son expertise dans les énergies solaire et hydraulique, les filiales cherchent à répondre aux défis actuels liés au changement climatique en offrant des solutions viables et à fort impact environnemental.

En collaboration avec les ingénieurs et les responsables opérationnels, vous aurez à charge de concevoir les outils permettant l’amélioration des analyses de données sur l’ensemble des métiers du Groupe, à savoir l’énergie (centrales photovoltaïques, hydroélectriques, hydrogène, biogaz), l’immobilier et la mobilité électrique (infrastructures de recharge AC / DC pour véhicules électriques).




MISSIONS

Dans ce contexte, vous occupez le poste de Data Analyst Junior H/F et vos principales missions seront les suivantes :




Collecte et gestion des données

Assurer la remontée et le stockage des données issues de nos centrales photovoltaïques, hydroélectriques et infrastructures de recharge pour véhicules électriques.
Contribuer à la gestion et l’optimisation des bases de données (Cloud ou Serveur physique).

Analyse et visualisation

Exploiter les données pour identifier des tendances et améliorer la performance énergétique.
Mettre en place des tableaux de bord et indicateurs clés de performance (KPI) avec Power BI ou Excel.
Participer à l’élaboration de rapports analytiques sur les performances des installations.

Développement et automatisation

Aider à la conception d’outils facilitant le traitement et la croisée des bases de données.
Participer à l’intégration de données externes (météo, prix de l’électricité, etc.) pour affiner les analyses.
Contribuer au développement et à l'amélioration des API pour l’exploitation des données.




PROFIL RECHERCHE




Formation : Bac+5 en école d’ingénieur ou université avec spécialisation en Data Science, Informatique ou Énergie.

Compétences :

Maîtrise d’Excel (VBA souhaité).
Connaissance en SQL, Python et/ou Power BI.
Bonnes compétences analytiques et capacité à manipuler de grandes bases de données.
Esprit rigoureux, autonome et curieux.
Bon niveau d’anglais écrit et oral.




CONDITIONS D’EMPLOI

CDI 39h/semaine
1 RTT/mois
Tickets restaurants
Statut : Cadre
Rémunération : selon expérience




Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A LBC é uma empresa de consultoria estratégica, transformação digital e de desenvolvimento de talento, com experiência em mais de 1.200 projetos em 18 países, 17 setores e 20 entidades multilaterais como o Banco Mundial, Programa das Nações Unidas para o Desenvolvimento, União Europeia, Banco Africano de Desenvolvimento, entre outros.

Requisitos


Licenciatura nas áreas de Gestão, Economia, Matemática, Estatística, Informática ou Gestão de Informação
3 anos de experiência em projetos de Data Analytics ou Business Intelligence
Experiência em projetos de Data Warehousing ou plataformas de business intelligence, Modelação de bases de dados, Bases de dados relacionais e NoSQL, Utilização de ferramentas ETL, Qualidade de Dados, Técnicas de Visualização e Reporting
Experiência em projetos com metodologias ágeis
Motivação, autonomia e rigor
Forte espírito de equipa e excelente capacidade colaborativa
Conhecimentos / Experiência em Python é valorizado
Conhecimentos / Experiência Hadoop e stack Apache relacionada, principalmente Kafka é valorizado
Conhecimentos / Experiência em Power BI é valorizado
Fluente em Português


Principais responsabilidades


Integração numa equipa multidisciplinar e participação em projetos de consultoria tecnológica
Apoio na implementação de novas fontes de informação e evolução de soluções inteligentes de gestão de dados
Análise e integração de dados relacionados com a atividade específica de cada cliente
Desenvolvimento de modelos de data quality
Desenvolvimento de modelos de sincronização de dados
Apoio na especificação funcional de soluções técnicas
Apoio no desenvolvimento e execução de testes
Colaboração direta com analistas de negócio, designers e developers


O que oferecemos


Uma oportunidade de trabalhar numa empresa líder e inovadora (premiada pela Revista Exame na categoria Digital Leaders 2023 e Melhores Empresas para Trabalhar)
Desenvolvimento contínuo de competências e carreira
Uma cultura de trabalho colaborativo e de apoio
Remuneração competitiva e pacote de benefícios


Candidata-te Já Pelo Nosso Site

The best future is the one you create and imagine for yourself

Title: Data Analyst - Power BI
Description:
En Claire Joster somos especialistas en la búsqueda y selección de Perfiles cualificados de Mando Intermedio y Management en el ámbito tecnológico para las principales áreas funcionales y técnicas, con un valor añadido fundamental: la captación de talento, basada en valores y ajuste cultural de nuestros clientes y candidatos.




Actualmente estamos buscando un perfil de Data Analyst para un partner tecnológico especializado en diseño y ejecución de soluciones tecnológicas en colaboración con importantes clientes, con dos pilares fundamentales: excelencia e innovación.




Requisitos:

Al menos 2 años de experiencia profesional como Analista de Datos.
Titulación en un campo cuantitativo (Informática, Ingeniería, Matemáticas, Física, etc…) o similar.
Capacidad de comunicación eficaz y capacidad para trabajar con otros departamentos.
Pensamiento lógico y resolutivo.
Dominio de SQL (SQL Server, Postgres).
Experiencia de trabajo con sistemas BI y herramientas de visualización.
2 años de experiencia en Power BI.
Usuario competente del paquete MS Office y usuario experto de Excel.




Se Ofrece:

Contrato indefinido y posibilidad de crecimiento.
Ubicación del cliente: Arturo Soria.
Modalidad Presencial.
Beneficios Sociales: Seguro médico.

Title: Data Analyst con Power BI
Description:
¡Ampliamos nuestro equipo! 🔎




¿Buscas un nuevo reto donde desarrollar tu carrera y aprender nuevas tecnologías? Entonces sigue leyendo porque esto te puede interesar.




Scalian es una empresa de más de 6.000 personas con una dimensión internacional, con oficinas en Europa y América del Norte. Estamos especializados en dar servicios a diferentes clientes enfocados en Data, Cloud e Inteligencia Artificial.




¿Qué buscamos?

Buscamos un/a Data Analyst con Power BI para integrarse en nuestro equipo de profesionales de Scalian. Dentro de este rol estarás desarrollando las siguientes funciones:

Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener informes y dashboards interactivos en Power BI que proporcionen insights clave para diferentes áreas de la empresa.
Crear y mantener medidas y cálculos complejos utilizando DAX para proporcionar análisis avanzados y personalizados.
Colaborar estrechamente con el Data Engineering Lead y su equipo para garantizar que los modelos de datos sean óptimos para el reporting.
Aplicar las mejores prácticas de diseño de visualizaciones para asegurar claridad, accesibilidad y usabilidad.
Asegurar que los informes y dashboards estén actualizados y reflejen los datos más recientes, implementando actualizaciones y mejoras continuas.




Requisitos mínimos:

Sólidos conocimientos puestos en práctica con Power BI.
Experiencia y conocimiento de DAX.
Fluidez escrita y hablada en inglés.
Valorable tener certificaciones de Power BI.




¿Qué tendrás con nosotros?

🚀 Formar parte de un equipo de alto nivel bajo tecnologías punteras en el mercado.

💻 Modalidad 100% teletrabajo

⛱ 25 días laborables de vacaciones

📝 Contrato indefinido

📚 Formación continua, certificaciones, meetups y planes de desarrollo profesional personalizados para que podamos seguir creciendo juntos. Contamos con acceso a plataformas internas con contenido abierto para que lo disfrutes cuando tú quieras y a tu ritmo.

🕐 Jornada completa con horario flexible para facilitar la conciliación entre vida familiar y profesional.

🎉 After works en las oficinas

🎂 La tarde del cumpleaños libre

🏋️‍♀️ Descuentos en gimnasios

💲Programas de retribución flexible: seguro médico, tarjeta restaurante, abono de transporte, cheques para escuelas infantiles.

🌏 Como parte del grupo Scalian, abrimos nuestras fronteras y crecemos internacionalmente.

♻️ En el grupo apostamos por iniciativas sostenibles.




¡Despega en tu carrera con Scalian Spain!✈

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.




DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.




DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are searching for a Data Analyst!




Responsabilities:

You support to migrate current developed reports from Tableau On-premises to Tableau Cloud.
You collaborate with your data science team to smoothly switch reporting used data source from Microsoft SQL Server to Microsoft Azure.
You rebuild current developed reports with modern look and feel.
You reconfigure current developed reports if any business logics are changed while migration.
You develop new reports to support customers’ needs.
You work in a cross functional agile environment with an international team.
You stay updated on the latest advancements in data science, business intelligence, etc.




Requirements:

You have a Bachelor or Master degree in the field of Statistics, Business informatics, Econometrics or any related discipline.
You are fully skilled with Tableau, ideally certificated with “Tableau Certified Data Analyst” or higher.
You are experienced in Tableau environment and familiar with the DAX functions.
You bring work experience in any relevant field, ideally 5 years at least in similar analytical context with relevant quests for ITSM. (e.g. Incident Management, Problem Management, etc.) or CMDB (Configuration Management Database)
You are experienced in working in agile team and you can proactively explore and communicate findings.
You bring a strong expertise in cloud as well as on-premises storage systems. (preferably MS SQL Server and Azure services)
You have an analytical mindset with strong knowledge, and you are capable of communicating findings through the cross functional team.
You are fluent in English.




If you’re interested in this job, please send your CV in to vanessa.romao@decskill.com with reference “VR/DataAnalyst”.




Thank You!




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Reporting Analyst with Tableau
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to accomplish their financial goals and help them save time and money.

Job Description

We are looking for Reporting Analyst with experience with Tableau and will report to Data Mdeller manager.

You're Probably Wondering What You'll Do


Create reports and dashboards using Tableau or other tools, ensuring partners have reliable and applicable data
Perform in-depth benchmark analysis to provide valuable insights, uncover trends and business opportunities
Keep Tableau dashboards up to date, troubleshoot issues, and optimize performance to meet evolving our needs
Address ad-hoc requests, troubleshoot data issues, and ensure, accurate reporting
Collaborate with analytical and consultancy teams across Experian using all communication channels


Qualifications

We look for you to bring:


University Degree in a quantitative subject as Mathematics, Statistics, Informatics, Economics, Physics or related
Good Excel (can perform complex functions) knowledge
Analytical and technical skills and Stay informed about relevant technology trends and developments
Very good command of English – both written and spoken
The following abilities will be considered an advantage:
Knowledge of the UK Credit Market
1+ years of experience with BI/Dashboarding/Reporting tools
Experience in SQL


Additional Information

What you will get:


Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
Social benefits package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance for you and a family member, monthly flex allowance including internet bill coverage, sick leave allowance, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many more!
Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in social responsibility events.
Opportunity for flexible working hours and home office.
Personal Development - career pathways for professional growth supported by learning and development programmes and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials and books.


Our Social Benefits Package - the way we care for our People

Our uniqueness is that we celebrate yours. Experian's culture and people are important differentiators. We take our people agenda very seriously and focus on what matters; DEI, work/life balance, development, authenticity, collaboration, wellness, reward & recognition, volunteering... the list goes on. Experian's people first approach is award-winning; World's Best Workplaces™ 2024 (Fortune Top 25), Great Place To Work™ in 24 countries, and Glassdoor Best Places to Work 2024 to name a few. Check out Experian Life on social or our Careers Site to understand why.

Experian is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Innovation is an important part of Experian's DNA and practices, and our diverse workforce drives our success. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
We help companies modernize business operations, adopt intelligent automation, deliver real-time performance insights and connect the enterprise - accelerating the impact of digital transformation. Founded in 1987 and recognized as a trusted advisor, HSO is one of the world's top business solution and implementation partners, large enough to serve, small enough to care. We are 100% dedicated to Microsoft technology, with practices that offer our clients a complete set of Microsoft cloud solutions from a single global partner. HSO is a proven global leader with unique delivery capabilities offered from our dedicated Microsoft practices in more than 30 offices across the Americas, Europe, Australia and Asia.

HSO is a Gold Certified partner since 2002 and since 2006 has been a part of the Microsoft Dynamics Inner Circle, a prestige reserved for just 1% of Microsoft partners worldwide. Within HSO you'll work with Microsoft Dynamics 365, Azure cloud platform and our unique, industry-specific solutions.

We are a dynamic and innovative company dedicated to leveraging data to drive business insights and decisions. Our team is passionate about technology and data, and we are looking for a talented Data Engineer / Data Analyst to join us.

Key Responsibilities


Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL processes
Analyze complex datasets to derive actionable insights and support decision-making
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver solutions
Develop and maintain data models, databases, and data warehouses
Create and manage dashboards and reports to visualize data trends and metrics
Ensure data quality and integrity through rigorous testing and validation
Optimize data processes for performance and scalability



Requirements


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
Proven experience as a Data Engineer, Data Analyst, or in a similar role
Proficiency in Fabric, SQL, Python, and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI)
Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) is a plus
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities



Benefits

Why choose HSO?

Freedom and flexibility

An organization with a lot of professional freedom and flexibility where we make the best choices together to optimize your development process during your career.

Culture

An open and accessible work environment full of colleagues who are always there for each other. We are one big HSO Team. Because without cooperation and fun, there is no success!

Development and growth

A job with plenty of growth opportunities in an organisation with an eye for your talents, ambitions and the things that drive you.

A good remuneration package

An excellent salary and fringe benefits include a laptop, mobile phone, flexible incentive plan, large office offering a collaborative environment with a modern design and free parking in Amsterdam.

Do you want to be part of a fast-growing company and work with many international colleagues? Then you can apply immediately!

Title: Data Analyst – Digital Transformation
Description:
Job title: Data Analyst – Digital Transformation

Sector: Technology

Location: Dublin (Hybrid)

Salary: Negotiable plus bonus, health, and pension




Our Client

Our client is a fast-growing technology company with a strong presence in the digital transformation space. They specialise in providing innovative solutions that enhance automation, data-driven decision-making, and cloud adoption. With a focus on continuous growth and market expansion, they are now looking to hire a Data Analyst to strengthen their analytics capabilities.




Why Should You Apply?

Opportunity to work in a forward-thinking company that values data-driven insights.
Collaborate with a highly skilled team in an agile and innovative environment.
Work on cutting-edge data projects with cloud-based technologies.
Great potential for career progression within a rapidly expanding organisation.




Who Should Apply?

This role is ideal for professionals with a strong analytical background and a passion for data, including:

2+ years of experience in data analysis.
A degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, computer science, or a related field.
Proficiency in SQL, Python, or R for data analysis.
Experience with data visualisation tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Familiarity with cloud-based data platforms (AWS, Snowflake, DBT, or Redshift).
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Ability to translate data insights into actionable recommendations.




Role and Reporting Lines

This position reports to the Data Analytics Lead and will involve:

Developing and maintaining key datasets and data models.
Collecting, processing, and analysing large datasets to support business decisions.
Creating dashboards and reports to visualise insights for stakeholders.
Collaborating with engineers and business leaders to define data requirements.
Ensuring data quality, integrity, and governance across platforms.
Implementing best practices in data management and analytics.
Staying up to date with industry trends and emerging data technologies.




Interested in this position?

To apply, please submit your CV to Emma Murphy, who is managing this assignment, via the link below. For further inquiries, please contact Emma directly.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Overview

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our growing team and help transform raw data into meaningful insights. This role requires a mix of technical expertise, analytical thinking, and business acumen. You will work closely with stakeholders to develop visualizations, optimize data processes, and support AI-driven analytics initiatives.




Responsibilities

Analyze, interpret, and visualize data to provide actionable insights.
Collaborate with business stakeholders and IT teams to define data requirements.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations using Power BI or similar tools.
Conduct data validation to ensure accuracy and consistency across systems.
Troubleshoot and optimize SQL queries and ETL processes.
Support AI initiatives by quantifying and structuring data for AI-driven models.
Take ownership of databases and documentation, ensuring data integrity.
Continuously learn and contribute to process improvements and mentorship within the team.




Required Qualifications

1-2 years of hands-on experience in data analysis, machine learning, and SQL.
Strong SQL skills for querying, data validation, and ETL processes.
Experience with Python for data manipulation, automation, and predictive modeling.
Familiarity with machine learning concepts (experience with AI-driven data models is a plus).
Proficiency in Power BI or other data visualization tools.
Experience working with medium-to-large datasets, with the ability to discuss dataset size and complexity.
Strong problem-solving skills—asks "why" and digs deeper into data beyond surface-level insights.
Excellent communication skills—able to explain complex data concepts in a clear and logical manner.
Takes ownership and proactively seeks opportunities to improve data processes.
Passionate about AI and data analytics, viewing this role as a stepping stone into more advanced AI/ML work.
Ability to adapt in a fast-paced environment and learn new technologies quickly.
Understanding of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) is a plus.




Preferred Qualifications

Experience with AI-driven analytics projects.
Exposure to cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud).
Background in statistical modeling or predictive analytics.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At H2Ok Innovations, we're leading the charge in cleantech innovation, reshaping process industrials and manufacturing to drive operational efficiency and sustainability for our world’s most foundational industries. Powered by our H2Ok AI Co-pilot models and state-of-the-art sensors, our solutions optimize facility performance across various processes, including process manufacturing, production, water management, energy reduction, and waste minimization. Based at Greentown Labs, North America's premier cleantech innovation community, we're a woman-founded startup backed by renowned investors like Construct Capital, 2048 Ventures, and Flybridge Capital. Our groundbreaking technologies have earned accolades and adoption from industry giants like Unilever, The Coca-Cola Company, ABinBev, and Mitsubishi Electric. We're committed to unlocking untapped data for our customers, empowering them to gain a competitive edge and create Industry 4.0.

Transforming our most foundational sectors of society is hard. Very hard. But we’re building an empire. And empire building is not easy. It’s deeply fulfilling, and you will learn and grow tremendously while driving sustainable impact globally with some of the largest players that make everything we eat, use, and wear. Our culture is to foster extraordinary growth within our teammates. We believe in autonomy, ownership, empowerment, demanding excellence, being mission-driven. We believe in creativity, authenticity, and extraordinary growth. We’re looking for relentless, ambitious, creative, and exceptional people to join our team and build the factory of the future.

As our company scales, we're in search of a full-time Data Analyst to join our expanding team. As a Data Analyst, you will work directly with customers on high-impact immediate problems – interpreting, explaining, and ultimately bringing life to their data. Based on your analysis, you will use H2Ok’s ML platform to build machine learning models that drive value for our customers, saving them time, water, and energy. Your responsibilities will look similar to those of a hands-on AI startup CTO where you will work cross-functionally in sales, customer success, and product delivery to own the delivery of high-impact projects to global clients. The ideal candidate is an excellent critical thinker, a clear and engaging communicator, and knows how to not only explain data, but how to tell a compelling story. Having a background in chemical engineering, process engineering, mechanical engineering, or computer science is a plus.

What You Will Do


Analyze data from some of the largest factories in the world to identify process inefficiencies, anomalies, and areas of potential optimization
Interpret, explain, and shed light on complex data through engaging presentations and live demonstrations to customers and internal stakeholders.
Use H2Ok’s ML platform to train, evaluate, and deploy machine learning models to unlock additional factory uptime and deliver time, energy, and water savings.
Apply critical thinking and first principles knowledge to solve challenging, real-world problems in factories, breweries, food & beverage facilities, and more.
Collaborate with data scientists, software engineers, and customer stakeholders to ensure models are performant, reliable, and aligned with customer needs





About You


Fluent in analyzing, understanding, and communicating about data, especially time-series data or sensor data.
Willing to work directly with customers to explain model results, data analysis, and conclusions from data in a clear, engaging, and succinct way.
Skilled in data storytelling and visualization.
Can create engaging, colorful visualizations for customers that bring data to life and provide insight.
Experienced with presenting data and communicating results to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Experienced with Python, including numerical libraries (such as NumPy and Pandas) and familiar with at least one ML framework (such as Scikit-Learn, PyTorch, TensorFlow, JAX).
Familiar training, fine-tuning, and evaluating performance of machine learning models. Familiar with SQL or similar database systems (such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB)
Experienced with Git or other version control systems
Analytical thinker with the ability to solve complex problems efficiently
Excellent communication skills to articulate technical issues, solutions, and progress effectively
Adaptability to learn new technologies and adapt to evolving project requirements
Strong team player mindset, comfortable sharing knowledge and collaborating within a team environment
Familiarity with industrial processes and manufacturing industries such as chemicals, pharmaceuticals, food and beverage, CPG, brewing, dairy, and industrial controls (PLC/SCADA/DCS) is a strong plus





Benefits


Direct impact on product and culture
Comprehensive benefits package including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Disability, Transportation benefit, Health and Wellness benefit, and more
401k plan with employer matching
Equity
Competitive salary and bonus opportunities
Dynamic and inclusive work environment
Opportunities for growth and professional development
Access to Greentown Labs' extensive network of cleantech startups





Learn How We Think


Learn about our startup journey: Our Journey
How we're combating climate change: AI-Powered Climate Tech
A customer story: Ben & Jerry's uses H2Ok's precision automation to cut time & water usage





Why H2Ok Innovations?
Impact: Contribute to the transformation of the global industrial sector with cutting-edge innovation.

Growth: Join a fast-growing startup where you’ll have the opportunity to shape our content strategy. We value fostering extraordinary growth in our teammates.

Innovative Culture: Work in a high-performance environment that values empowerment, creativity, ownership, autonomy, innovation, excellence, passion, and continuous growth.

Sustainability Focus: Play a key role in promoting sustainability and Industry 4.0 advancements in manufacturing.

At H2Ok Innovations, we’re committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion, and we encourage applicants from all backgrounds to apply. If you're ready to play a key role in scaling a game-changing company that’s transforming the industrial sector and advancing sustainability, we want to hear from you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What You'll Do:


Partner with commercial teams to create and deliver Client Business Reviews, including custom analyses, optimization recommendations, media plans and forecasts to improve performance and drive incremental revenue
Design, manage, analyze, and communicate results of controlled A/B tests
Create and share market trends and benchmarks to support in strategic planning
Collaborate with Product Analytics to execute on performance-improving initiatives
Influence the Product Roadmap by sharing client needs and feedback with our product and R&D teams
Leverage the partnership with our Global Client Operations Center to identify ways to improve efficiency in executing tasks through automation or delegation
Develop expertise on a key growth area of the business.
Take ownership over knowledge sharing within the team and building client facing collateral
Troubleshoot campaign delivery and performance issues in time-sensitive, high-impact scenarios
Stay informed on industry trends and advancements in AdTech, analytics, forecasting, and attribution
Effectively communicate with teams and managers on project timelines and challenges



Who You Are:


Minimum 1 year full-time, analytics-relevant work experience with SQL
Native-level English fluency and strong presentation and public speaking skills, with the ability to present and defend complex analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Conceptual and practical understanding of statistics and real-world application of statistical concepts particularly in a testing context
Experience with internet advertising technology (tagging, cookies, trafficking) and digital marketing concepts is preferred



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

For employees based in the US, certain roles at Criteo are eligible for additional rewards, including quarterly or annual bonus and restricted stock units. US-based employees receive access to healthcare, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, family forming and wellness benefits, Flexible Work financial support, learning opportunities, and a robust annual leave plan including volunteer time off and summer vacation days.

The US base salary pay range for this position per year is:

$95,000 - $139,500

Title: STAT - Data Analyst
Description:
In November 2015, STAT was launched as a new national media brand focused on health, medicine, and life sciences. Since then, we have grown to be the authoritative and trustworthy news media source in the industry and our all-star team of editors and reporters have won numerous journalism awards, including being named as a 2021 Pulitzer finalist. The STAT brand includes a website (www.statnews.com), mobile app, numerous newsletters, live events and virtual events, and other products. STAT is based in Boston and is affiliated with Boston Globe Media Partners but is independent from The Boston Globe.

The Role

This role will expand the foundation for data literacy and data-driven decision making across the organization. Through the lens of growth and optimization, the role will help develop strategies for editorial, help accelerate product development, as well as optimize our business practices across all business units. This will be done using a myriad of data sources and in close partnerships across teams including editorial, social, subscriptions, and advertising.

What You’ll Do

Guide web and email analytics strategy: Work closely with the product, engineering, and design teams to guide how, where, and when we implement custom analytics on the site. Review tracking requirements for new features, support the QA team during implementation, and perform routine data maintenance, audits, and cleanup across all platforms.
Manage analytics reports and dashboards: Use Adobe Analytics, SQL/Python, Snowflake, and BI tools (e.g. Tableau) to design and deliver weekly/monthly reports, audience profiles, and dashboards to aid decision-making for editorial and business teams and senior leadership.
Manage recurring reporting: Design and deliver weekly/monthly reports, audience profiles, and performance dashboards to aid decision-making for functional teams. Reporting includes web, mobile and competitive data.
Answer ad hoc requests: Respond to ad hoc data requests including information on site traffic, readers’ online behavior, and site performance.
Develop measures of success: Work with relevant stakeholders to determine key measures of success with a focus on actionability; plan implementation with engineering and product teams; clearly communicate performance and recommendations to Product and Marketing
Collaborate with multiple teams: Work closely with Marketing, Product, Sales and Editorial to provide insight into audience behavior in order to drive site updates and initiatives that increase digital subscription revenue and/or advertising revenue
Get a holistic view: Develop an understanding of STAT’s products and technical stack to meet the company’s current and future needs

Who You Are

Extensive experience with web analytics platforms such as Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics
Experience in data analytics with proficient SQL
Strong sense of initiative and ability to drive projects run by multi-functional teams to completion
Ability to use BI tools and visualizations to tell clear data narratives
Excellent interpersonal skills
Self-directed and capable of working in a fast-paced environment
Ability to multi-task and adapt to change
Outstanding attention to detail and organizational skills
Highly motivated to excel with minimal supervision
Intellectual curiosity
A willingness to adapt and be audience focused, with a curious mindset and a commitment to creating an inclusive work environment 

Bonus Points

Experience with Snowflake
Coding knowledge, especially with Python
Strong knowledge of WordPress, CRMs, Customer Data Platforms, integration apps, email marketing, and marketing automation tools
Interest in journalism and life science and health news

We know that there are strong candidates who may not fit precisely into what we’ve described above or who have important skills we haven’t thought of. If that’s you, don’t hesitate to apply and tell us about yourself.

Compensation/Location

The minimum salary for this position is $70,000. We offer a competitive benefits package, including health insurance, a 401k plan, generous vacation, parental leave, and more. We also have numerous wellness offerings, including free access to HeadSpace for all full time employees.

We prefer you to be based in Boston or Washington, D.C., adhering to a hybrid schedule of in-office 3 days a week and work-from-home 2 days a week.
STAT’s Boston office is located in downtown Boston, nearby Faneuil Hall and Quincy Market, and is easily accessible by MBTA and commuter rail lines.
STAT’s Washington office is located in the Boston Globe’s downtown bureau and is easily accessible by multiple Metro lines and buses.

How to Apply

Interested in this job? If so, we’d love to hear from you. Please submit a cover letter and resume.

In your resume and/or cover letter, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example - she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc.).

STAT is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace. We strive to create a culture that encourages, supports, and celebrates all voices. A staff that reflects the world around us makes for better — and more accurate — journalism.

EEO Statement: At Boston Globe Media, our mission is to empower, connect, and convene our communities with independent, trusted journalism and storytelling. We know a critical part of achieving this is by having a workforce that is diverse, equitable, and inclusive - like the communities we serve. Boston Globe Media is an equal opportunity employer that welcomes candidates and colleagues of all backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and skills.

Show more

STAT is based in Boston and is affiliated with Boston Globe Media Partners but is independent from The Boston Globe.

The Role

This role will expand the foundation for data literacy and data-driven decision making across the organization. Through the lens of growth and optimization, the role will help develop strategies for editorial, help accelerate product development, as well as optimize our business practices across all business units. This will be done using a myriad of data sources and in close partnerships across teams including editorial, social, subscriptions, and advertising.

What You’ll Do

  • Guide web and email analytics strategy: Work closely with the product, engineering, and design teams to guide how, where, and when we implement custom analytics on the site. Review tracking requirements for new features, support the QA team during implementation, and perform routine data maintenance, audits, and cleanup across all platforms.
  • Manage analytics reports and dashboards: Use Adobe Analytics, SQL/Python, Snowflake, and BI tools (e.g. Tableau) to design and deliver weekly/monthly reports, audience profiles, and dashboards to aid decision-making for editorial and business teams and senior leadership.
  • Manage recurring reporting: Design and deliver weekly/monthly reports, audience profiles, and performance dashboards to aid decision-making for functional teams. Reporting includes web, mobile and competitive data.
  • Answer ad hoc requests: Respond to ad hoc data requests including information on site traffic, readers’ online behavior, and site performance.
  • Develop measures of success: Work with relevant stakeholders to determine key measures of success with a focus on actionability; plan implementation with engineering and product teams; clearly communicate performance and recommendations to Product and Marketing
  • Collaborate with multiple teams: Work closely with Marketing, Product, Sales and Editorial to provide insight into audience behavior in order to drive site updates and initiatives that increase digital subscription revenue and/or advertising revenue
  • Get a holistic view: Develop an understanding of STAT’s products and technical stack to meet the company’s current and future needs

Who You Are

  • Extensive experience with web analytics platforms such as Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics
  • Experience in data analytics with proficient SQL
  • Strong sense of initiative and ability to drive projects run by multi-functional teams to completion
  • Ability to use BI tools and visualizations to tell clear data narratives
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Self-directed and capable of working in a fast-paced environment
  • Ability to multi-task and adapt to change
  • Outstanding attention to detail and organizational skills
  • Highly motivated to excel with minimal supervision
  • Intellectual curiosity
  • A willingness to adapt and be audience focused, with a curious mindset and a commitment to creating an inclusive work environment 

Bonus Points

  • Experience with Snowflake
  • Coding knowledge, especially with Python
  • Strong knowledge of WordPress, CRMs, Customer Data Platforms, integration apps, email marketing, and marketing automation tools
  • Interest in journalism and life science and health news

  • We know that there are strong candidates who may not fit precisely into what we’ve described above or who have important skills we haven’t thought of. If that’s you, don’t hesitate to apply and tell us about yourself.

    Compensation/Location

    The minimum salary for this position is $70,000. We offer a competitive benefits package, including health insurance, a 401k plan, generous vacation, parental leave, and more. We also have numerous wellness offerings, including free access to HeadSpace for all full time employees.

    We prefer you to be based in Boston or Washington, D.C., adhering to a hybrid schedule of in-office 3 days a week and work-from-home 2 days a week.
    STAT’s Boston office is located in downtown Boston, nearby Faneuil Hall and Quincy Market, and is easily accessible by MBTA and commuter rail lines.
    STAT’s Washington office is located in the Boston Globe’s downtown bureau and is easily accessible by multiple Metro lines and buses.

    How to Apply

    Interested in this job? If so, we’d love to hear from you. Please submit a cover letter and resume.

    In your resume and/or cover letter, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example - she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc.).

    STAT is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace. We strive to create a culture that encourages, supports, and celebrates all voices. A staff that reflects the world around us makes for better — and more accurate — journalism.

    EEO Statement: At Boston Globe Media, our mission is to empower, connect, and convene our communities with independent, trusted journalism and storytelling. We know a critical part of achieving this is by having a workforce that is diverse, equitable, and inclusive - like the communities we serve. Boston Globe Media is an equal opportunity employer that welcomes candidates and colleagues of all backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and skills.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

📍 Hybrid | Framingham, MA

💰 Market Salary: $55,000 – $70,000 per year




Are you an analytical problem-solver with a background in logistics, claims, or supply chain? Join our team as a Data Analyst within the Cargo and Claims team where you'll play a crucial role in investigating cargo loss, resolving claims, and improving delivery outcomes.




To learn more about the role and client please follow this link




What You’ll Do:

📊 Analyze and interpret cargo loss data to identify trends and claim opportunities.

🔍 Research and validate delivery exceptions using Business Intelligence tools.

📦 Work cross-functionally with Fulfillment, Delivery, Customer Service, and 3PL providers.

📑 Prepare and file claims with accuracy while ensuring timely resolutions.

📈 Monitor and improve courier performance by conducting proof-of-delivery audits.

⚡ Handle ad hoc projects and shift focus to meet business needs.

What You Bring:

✔ Experience: 1-3 years in Claims, Transportation, or Logistics/Supply Chain.

✔ Technical Skills: Proficiency in Business Intelligence tools (Tableau, Power BI) & Microsoft Suite.

✔ Analytical Mindset: Ability to interpret large data sets, identify trends, and drive solutions.

✔ Communication Skills: Strong verbal and written abilities for collaboration.

✔ Education: Bachelor’s degree preferred but not required.

Why Join Us?

🌟 Hybrid Work Model – Work from home & on-site in Framingham, MA.

🎉 Flexible PTO – 22 days + 7 paid holidays.

💼 Comprehensive Benefits – 401(k) match, health & wellness programs, and retail discounts.

🌍 Inclusive Culture – Employee-led Business Resource Groups & professional growth opportunities.

Ready to Apply?

🚀 Take the next step in your career—apply today via our quick apply platform.

Title: Data Analyst 1, SRS
Description:
Posting Description

DATA ANALYST 1, Political Science , to join a team that is at the forefront of leveraging advanced computational techniques to deepen our understanding of politics; work to assist in the development of data pipelines, data models, and data operations infrastructure; employ a variety of technical tools to design and improve the LobbyView database; and help researchers and technical staff solve the most challenging computational problems in social science research and establish pipelines for queries and analyses, with other forays into relevant technical areas as time and curiosity allows.

Job Requirements

REQUIRED : Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, related technical domain, or in a social science field with relevant portfolio/experience; experience with SQL databases, especially PostgreSQL, encompassing query writing, server management, and database optimization; experience with Python, especially familiarity with standard web scraping, data science, and concurrent processing libraries; experience using and/or writing REST APIs; experience with Git or analogous version control systems; robust written and oral communication skills; and a minimum of one year of relevant experience in analyzing and modeling data sets and creating informative reports and dashboards. PREFERRED : A public portfolio and/or extracurricular interest in technical projects (e.g. hobby projects, open-source contributions, competitive coding, etc); experience with modern web development, such as applied experience with TypeScript; experience with other modern programming languages, especially R; experience with modern data engineering tools, such as DuckDB, Dagster, and dbt; experience with exploratory data analysis, data visualization, and dashboarding; experience with Unix/Linux-based operating systems, including bash shell scripting and/or Linux system administration best practices; experience with cloud technologies, especially AWS. Job #24883-6

3/12/2025

Title: Data Analyst with Power BI experience
Description:
This Boston-based home services firm is looking to hire a Data Analyst to join their Boston team. Located near Boston North Station, the role will be hybrid, 2-3 days in the office, so someone local to Boston. You will need at least 1 year of professional experience building dashboards and reports in Power BI. This person should have solid SQL skills and any experience working with Snowflake, doing data transformation and cleansing work would be a big plus. The company is growing and while you are the first data hire, the team will grow in the future!




Responsibilities

Understand the day-to-day issues that our business faces, which can be better understood with data
Compile and analyze data related to business issues
Develop clear visualizations to convey complicated data in a straightforward fashion
Ability to work with external consultants and learn quickly




Qualifications




Bachelor's or Master's degree in Analytics, Applied Mathematics, or equivalent experience
2+ years of professional Data Analysis experience working with Power BI
Ability to support Operations, Finance, Sales, and Marketing
Solid SQL experience in data transformation, data ingestion, and cleansing
Snowflake, Fivetran, or Databricks will be a big plus
Comfortable meeting with company executives and working as the sole internal data resource.
Proactive, someone who finds ways data can impact the business before being asked.




This company cannot support OPT, provide sponsorship, visa transfer, or C2C.

Title: Scientific Data Analyst
Description:
Northreach is a dynamic recruitment agency that connects businesses with top talent in the cell & gene therapy, fintech, and digital sectors. Our mission is to provide a seamless and personalised recruitment experience for clients and candidates, and to create a positive work environment that encourages equality, innovation, and professional growth.




We have partnered with a fully integrated, commercial-stage biopharmaceutical company dedicated to the acquisition, development, and commercialization of innovative treatments for B-cell diseases. Alongside a robust research pipeline featuring multiple investigational medicines, we have received approvals from both the US FDA and the EU EMA for a product that treats multiple sclerosis.




Technical & Scientific Responsibilities:




Assist in managing and maintaining a comprehensive database of analytical data.
Analyze and interpret large datasets from diverse analytical assays to support product characterization, development, release, and stability studies.
Generate meaningful insights to enhance assay performance evaluation and product quality assessment.
Collaborate with analytical scientists, quality teams, and the MSAT group to integrate data-driven insights into workflows.
Develop interactive dashboards and reports to effectively communicate findings across cross-functional teams.
Support regulatory filing requirements.




Qualifications:




Ph.D. or M.S. in Analytical Chemistry, Biochemistry, or a related field.
Strong analytical and writing skills, with proficiency in Excel.
At least 3 years of experience in biopharmaceutical analytics and data analysis.
Expertise in analytical assays for monoclonal antibodies (mAbs).
Strong proficiency in statistical analysis, multivariate analysis, and data visualization.
Excellent problem-solving, communication, and collaboration skills.
Self-motivated, curious, and eager to develop innovative data systems at TG.




Are you looking for a role that allows you to work at the intersection of biopharmaceutical innovation and data science to accelerate mAb development? Are you looking for an opportunity to collaborate with some of the industries leading scientists? Look no further, let's have a chat.




I look forward to seeing your application.

Title: Data Science Co-op
Description:
At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com

Job Function

Career Programs

Job Sub Function

Non-LDP Intern/Co-Op

Job Category

Career Program

All Job Posting Locations:

Danvers, Massachusetts, United States of America

Job Description

Johnson & Johnson is currently seeking a Data Science Co-op to join our Innovation team located in Danvers, MA.

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.

Position Summary

The Applied Research - Critical Care team is looking for a co-op or intern to support our early-stage research and development programs. The candidate will be involved in solving data science and data analytics problems. With defined requirements, the candidate will be responsible for designing algorithms for products, building machine learning tools and doing data analysis.


Implement machine learning for new or existing algorithms
Design and translate algorithms for products and internal analysis tools
Research in new applications of data science within the company
Conduct data analysis for internal or external groups


Key Responsibilities

The student will:


Assist in the design and training of Machine Learning models for Clinical Decision Support
Provide input into process development and improvement
Analyze data and present results to larger Engineering team


Requirements


Senior or Grad student pursuing a degree in data science, computer science, computer engineering, software engineering, AI, or statistics Strong Machine Learning background with Deep Learning experience (Tensorflow, Keras Pytorch), time series modeling experience
Proficient in at least one programming language (Python preferred) and solid understanding of data structures & algorithms.
Solid understanding of statistics, strong analytical skills
Self-motivated, execute tasks in a timely manner
Demonstrated communication skills, both written and verbal


Preffered Requirements


Demonstrated experience with tuning and evaluating Large Language Models on variety of tasks including Named Entity Recognition and Question -Answering
Knowledge in Data Science / Machine Learning libraries (numpy, pandas, matplotlib, sklearn, nltk)
Experience in signal processing
Big data / cloud experience (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, Hadoop, Spark, Hive) Displayed interest in medical device industry


Permanently authorized to work in the U.S., must not require sponsorship of an employment visa (e.g., H-1B or green card) at the time of application or in the future. Students currently on CPT, OPT, or STEM OPT usually requires future sponsorship for long term employment and do not meet the requirements for this program unless eligible for an alternative long-term status that does not require company sponsorship.

Additional description for pay transparency: The anticipated base pay for this position is between 22$ per hour and 51.50$ per hour but will be based on candidate's program year, discipline, degree and/or experience. This position is overtime eligible. Intern/Co-ops may be eligible to participate in Company employee benefit programs such as medical insurance, sick time, holiday pay, and the Company’s consolidated retirement plan in accordance with the terms of the applicable plans. Housing stipend will be offered for those that qualify. This position is ineligible for severance. For additional general information on Company benefits, please go to: https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits

Johnson & Johnson is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by federal, state or local law. We actively seek qualified candidates who are protected veterans and individuals with disabilities as defined under VEVRAA and Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act.

Johnson and Johnson is committed to providing an interview process that is inclusive of our applicants’ needs. If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request an accommodation, please email the Employee Health Support Center (ra-employeehealthsup@its.jnj.com) or contact AskGS to be directed to your accommodation resource.

The anticipated base pay range for this position is :

22$ per hour to 51.50$ per hour

The anticipated base pay for this position is between 22$ per hour and 51.50$ per hour but will be based on candidate's program year, discipline, degree and/or experience. This position is overtime eligible. Intern/Co-ops may be eligible to participate in Company employee benefit programs such as medical insurance, sick time, holiday pay, and the Company’s consolidated retirement plan in accordance with the terms of the applicable plans. Title: Power BI Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities

Kforce has a client that is seeking a Power BI Data Analyst for a 6-month contract remote role. Overview of the role:


Power BI Data Analyst will document around queries, tables, and validity rates
Unique nuances to be tackled in this role
Extensive documentation and special projects support
Regular analysis
Special projects to take on, net new
As a Power BI Data Analyst, you will collaborate with various teams across the organization
Work with other data management teams


Requirements


4+ years of related experience
Power BI - required
Heavy data - SQL queries, understanding table joins and data sets - required
Heavy on Data QA
Collaboration - required
Documentation, heavy attention to detail - required
Self-starting, following the queue - required
Salesforce experience - useful


The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.

Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.

This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

By clicking “Apply Today” you agree to receive calls, AI-generated calls, text messages or emails from Kforce and its affiliates, and service providers. Note that if you choose to communicate with Kforce via text messaging the frequency may vary, and message and data rates may apply. Carriers are not liable for delayed or undelivered messages. You will always have the right to cease communicating via text by using key words such as STOP.

By clicking “Apply Today” you agree to receive calls, AI-generated calls, text messages or emails from Kforce and its affiliates, and service providers. Note that if you choose to communicate with Kforce via text messaging the frequency may vary, and message and data rates may apply. Carriers are not liable for delayed or undelivered messages. You will always have the right to cease communicating via text by using key words such as STOP.

Title: Data Analyst Consultant
Description:
We are currently looking for a passionate Data Analyst Consultant to join our team in Boston! This role is hybrid and will require 1-2 days of onsite work in New Bedford, MA.




WHO ARE WE?

MIGSO-PCUBED is a consulting firm that focuses solely on Project, Program, and Portfolio Management and Change Management. We work with clients in a variety of sectors such as Financial Services, Energy, Aerospace and Defense, and Automotive. You will have the opportunity to vary your experience and support our leading clients in these areas!




We are looking for someone who is eager to learn and develop project plans to enable quality decision making while delivering added value. You should be a logical thinker, adept at collecting, compiling, analyzing and presenting data to key stakeholders. You should have the ability to build and foster client relationships , and focus on service delivery, quality work product, and exceeding project deliverables.




YOUR NEXT CHALLENGE:

· Creating dashboards in Power BI/Tableau/Qlik Sense or other relevant tools

· Gathering requirements from business stakeholders and translating into technical requirements

· Normalizing, cleaning, and procuring data from various sources (Internal/External)

· Creating, managing, and communicating data models

· Understanding commonly used business continuity and collaboration tools (SharePoint, MS Teams, Power Automate, etc)

· Knowledge of machine learning, natural language processing, robotic process automation, and statistical modeling are a huge plus

· Practical experience working in Waterfall and Agile project management settings




As an MIGSO-PCUBED consultant, you will deliver our expertise, adapt to new environments and work as part of a team. You will represent our brand on the client site and thanks to the materials that we provide, you will be prepared and polished to support our engagements.




WHO ARE YOU?

You should have a least a Bachelor’s Degree, 2-5 years of Data Analysis/Data Science experience working in a Project environment, and you want to develop yourself in consulting. You should also have experience with SharePoint web development. Comprehensive MS Project Online knowledge is required as well.




If this sounds like you, then we want to meet you!




MIGSO-PCUBED recognizes the civil right of every person to obtain and maintain employment without discrimination. We have a longstanding policy that no individual may be refused a job, discharged, or discriminated against in any way due to any protected characteristics established by local, state and Federal law. In all respects, MIGSO-PCUBED is committed to a policy of full and fair equal employment under the law and applies this in all employment decisions, including recruitment, hiring, compensation, engagement staffing, training, promotion, transfer, and termination.

Title: Sr. Data Analyst
Description:
Location: 100% Remote

*Must reside and work in EST time zone*

Position Type: Long-term Contract




Responsible for performing tasks related to data profiling, data quality, data harmonization between multiple systems. Collecting and analyzing data to identify patterns, trends and insights as it relates to data quality and harmonization.




Responsibilities:

Collect, analyze, and validate data prior as part of an enterprise-wide data integration effort.
Construct and apply standard statistical analysis to ensure data accuracy.
Ensure data quality by gathering and entering missing data and resolving any anomalies.
Identify areas of improvement in data collection processes or systems and make recommendations to correct any deficiencies.
Work across business and technical teams to resolve data quality issues in the areas of merchandising, customer transactions, sales data, and supply chain




Qualifications:

5+ years of data analysis experience in a matrixed, enterprise environment
Retail and/or merchandising industry experience highly desired
Strong understanding of patterns in data, profiling data
Knowledge of cataloging data and what it makes to be able to understand data lineage
Excellent skills in Excel and SQL
Experience with data quality tools such as Purview, Collibra, Informatica Data Quality, etc.
Good communication skills
